intro: Sebaea exacoides, commonly known as the woolly sebaea, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy, woolly leaves and stems. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, often appearing in late summer. Sebaea exacoides is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its unique appearance and adaptability make it a notable species in its native habitat.
